activities.name: Get Fabric Account Token from AKV
activities.description:
This token will exprire every 1 hour, run Fabric notebook to get it again. Or you can save it to any DB and query it out to use.

### Notebook Python Code as below shared by lei.sun
access_token = mssparkutils.credentials.getToken("pbi") 
print("access token" + access_token) 

# (NOT suggested to share to cx) 
# By-design token will not show-upï¼Œcan show with below. Then, in notepad++, replace all '','' as empty string ''
a= list(access_token)
print(a)

activities.name: CRM attribute value ordered
activities.description:
MyEntity1:
Total 46744 rows.
randomly 6191 rows has not null values.

got 12118 rows with
<attribute name="cr4fc_productid" alias="ID" />
<attribute name="cr4fc_productvalue" alias="Value" />
<order attribute="cr4fc_productvalue" descending="true" />

got 46744 rows with 
<all-attributes />
<order attribute="cr4fc_productvalue" descending="true" />

source.query:
<fetch>
    <entity name="cr4fc_myentity1" >
<attribute name="cr4fc_productid" alias="ID" />
<attribute name="cr4fc_productvalue" alias="Value" />
<order attribute="cr4fc_productvalue" descending="true" />
      <filter>
      <condition attribute="modifiedon" operator="gt" value="2024-06-18 16:19:11" />
    </filter>
    </entity>
</fetch>

activities.name: CRM smallset attribute value ordered
activities.description:
MyEntity_Small :
1-15 rows value are nulls,
16-30 rows value are not null values,
30 rows in total

source.query:
<fetch>
    <entity name="cr4fc_myentity_small" >
        <attribute name="cr4fc_productvalue" alias="Value" />
<order attribute="cr4fc_productvalue" descending="true" />      
            <filter>
      <condition attribute="modifiedon" operator="gt" value="2024-06-18 16:19:11" />
    </filter>
    </entity>
</fetch>

<fetch>
    <entity name="cr4fc_myentity1" >
     <all-attributes />
     <order attribute="cr4fc_productvalue" descending="true" />
      <filter>
      <condition attribute="modifiedon" operator="gt" value="2024-06-18 16:19:11" />
    </filter>
    </entity>
</fetch>

activities.name: copy Oracle with query and partition
activities.description:
if oracle source is: ã€using query + using Dynamic range partition + do not want to set upper and lower boundsã€‘
Then:
you need to choose the table name in dataset and confirm that table contains the column you used for partition

source.oracleReaderQuery:
SELECT 
   *
FROM 
    ONEDRIVE_SINK o
JOIN 
    ONEDRIVE_SINK1 s
ON 
    o.NO = s.ID 
WHERE ?AdfRangePartitionColumnName <= ?AdfRangePartitionUpbound AND ?AdfRangePartitionColumnName >= ?AdfRangePartitionLowbound;

activities.name: Get OAuthToken with X509Cert JWT token
activities.description:
RUN PowerShell (use AAD app)
â€ªcd <PS script file path>
.\GetClientAssertion.ps1 -clientId 'f43557ff-9a53-430c-8054-700fde9500d8' -tenantId 'd1becd49-3f8d-435f-8618-f112b530e54c' -scope 'https://m365x68336840.sharepoint.com/.default'

activities.name: Get client_assertion
activities.description:
To generate JWT token (client_assertion), follow https://github.com/Chunlong101/SharePointTips/blob/46146e6517c15e1548b196f9b3f82a5ff086b2ac/Get%20access%20token%20with%20a%20certificate%20to%20call%20sharepoint%20rest%20api%20and%20graph%20api/GetAccessTokenByCert.ps1#L2

Stored In Rosina-AKV
RosinaSPO-ServicePrincipal-AADappCert-clientAssertion-JWT-token

# ----- 
# Step 1: Create a self-signed certificate, you can skip this step if you already have a one
# ----- 


$CERT_NAME = "MyX509Cert_AAD" # need replace
$CERT_PATH = "C:\Self-AssignedX509Cert" # need replace
$CERT_Store = "Cert:\CurrentUser\My" # MMC >> Add/Remove Snap-ins >> Certificates >> Current User >> Personal >> Your Certificates
$CERT_Subject = "CN=$($CERT_NAME)"

$cert = New-SelfSignedCertificate -Subject $CERT_Subject -CertStoreLocation $CERT_Store -KeyExportPolicy Exportable -KeySpec Signature -KeyLength 2048 -KeyAlgorithm RSA -HashAlgorithm SHA256 -Provider "Microsoft Enhanced RSA and AES Cryptographic Provider"

#Set-ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned #Unrestricted; may error due to policy,export manually
Export-Certificate -Cert $cert -FilePath "$CERT_PATH\$($CERT_NAME).cer" -Force

# Private key to Base64, not used for current scenario
$privateKey = [System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.RSACertificateExtensions]::GetRSAPrivateKey($cert)
$privateKeyBytes = $privateKey.Key.Export([System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyBlobFormat]::Pkcs8PrivateBlob)
$privateKeyBase64 = [System.Convert]::ToBase64String($privateKeyBytes, [System.Base64FormattingOptions]::InsertLineBreaks)
$privateKeyString = @"
-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
$privateKeyBase64
-----END PRIVATE KEY-----
"@
 
# Print private key to output
Write-Host $privateKeyString

# ----- 
# Step 2: Configure your app in azure app registrations
# ----- 

<# Open Azure Portal >> App registrations >> Your app >> Configure your app with proper SharePoint/Graph permissions, upload the certifcate to Azure App #>

# ----- 
# Step 3: Get the access token with the certificate to call SharePoint REST API and Graph API
# ----- 

# Define the Azure AD tenant ID and app client ID
$tenantId = "d1becd49-3f8d-435f-8618-f112b530e54c"  # need replace
$clientId = "f43557ff-9a53-430c-8054-700fde9500d8"  # need replace
$CERT_Store = "Cert:\CurrentUser\My" # need replace
$CERT_NAME = "MyX509Cert_AAD" # need replace
$CERT_Subject = "CN=$($CERT_NAME)"

<# Define the certificate thumbprint
$thumbprint = "9a2323356ba9c2c09753a0258bff8ae722b8687b" #"YOUR_CERTIFICATE_THUMBPRINT"
$cert = Get-Item Cert:\CurrentUser\My\$Thumbprint  #CurrentUser/LocalMachine
#>
$cert = Get-ChildItem -Path $CERT_Store | Where-Object { $_.Subject -Match $CERT_Subject } # | Select-Object FriendlyName, Thumbprint, Subject, NotBefore, NotAfter
$scope = "https://m365x68336840.sharepoint.com"  # need replace
<# for Graph api call test
$scope="https://graph.microsoft.com"
#>

# Function to generate a JWT token (client_assertion)
function GenerateJWT ($cert, $clientId, $tenantId, $scope) {
    $hash = $cert.GetCertHash()
    $hashValue = [System.Convert]::ToBase64String($hash) -replace '\+', '-' -replace '/', '_' -replace '='

    $exp = ([DateTimeOffset](Get-Date).AddHours(1).ToUniversalTime()).ToUnixTimeSeconds()
    $nbf = ([DateTimeOffset](Get-Date).ToUniversalTime()).ToUnixTimeSeconds()

    $jti = New-Guid
    [hashtable]$header = @{alg = "RS256"; typ = "JWT"; x5t = $hashValue }
    [hashtable]$payload = @{aud = "https://login.microsoftonline.com/$tenantId/oauth2/token"; iss = "$clientId"; sub = "$clientId"; jti = "$jti"; exp = $Exp; Nbf = $Nbf }

    $headerjson = $header | ConvertTo-Json -Compress
    $payloadjson = $payload | ConvertTo-Json -Compress

    $headerjsonbase64 = [Convert]::ToBase64String([System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($headerjson)).Split('=')[0].Replace('+', '-').Replace('/', '_')
    $payloadjsonbase64 = [Convert]::ToBase64String([System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($payloadjson)).Split('=')[0].Replace('+', '-').Replace('/', '_')

    $toSign = [System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($headerjsonbase64 + "." + $payloadjsonbase64)

    $rsa = $cert.PrivateKey # -as [System.Security.Cryptography.RSACryptoServiceProvider]

    $signature = [Convert]::ToBase64String($rsa.SignData($toSign, [Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName]::SHA256, [Security.Cryptography.RSASignaturePadding]::Pkcs1)) -replace '\+', '-' -replace '/', '_' -replace '='

    $token = "$headerjsonbase64.$payloadjsonbase64.$signature"

    return $token # client_assertion
}

# Get the client_assertion
$RequestToken = GenerateJWT -cert $cert -clientId $clientId -tenantId $tenantId -scope $scope

# Output the access token
# Write-Output "client_assertion: $AccessToken"

$RequestTokenString = @"
-----BEGIN client_assertion-----
$RequestToken
-----END client_assertion-----
"@
 
# Print private key to output
Write-Host $RequestTokenString

dependsOn.activity: Get OAuthToken with X509Cert JWT token

additionalHeaders.value: @{concat('Authorization: Bearer ', activity('Get OAuthToken with X509Cert JWT token').output.access_token)}

dataflowSinks.name: UserQueryADLSSink
dataflowSinks.script:
sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:['wrangled_books.csv'],
	umask: 0022,
	preCommands: [],
	postCommands: [],
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	partitionBy('hash', 1)) ~> UserQueryADLSSink

SELECT Id, CONVERTCURRENCY(Amount) Amount FROM Opportunity

activities.name: Copy data V2 AliasDif
activities.description:
SELECT 
Id, 
CONVERTCURRENCY(Total_ACV__c), 
CONVERTCURRENCY(Total_ACV__c) Total_ACV__c_new, 
FORMAT(CONVERTCURRENCY(Total_ACV__c)) Formated_Total_ACV__c_new 
FROM Opportunity
WHERE SystemModstamp > 2025-05-26T07:00:00Z

source.query:
SELECT 
Id, 
CONVERTCURRENCY(Total_ACV__c), 
CONVERTCURRENCY(Total_ACV__c) columnnew, 
FORMAT(CONVERTCURRENCY(Total_ACV__c)) Formated_Total_ACV__c_new 
FROM Opportunity
WHERE Total_ACV__c != null
SELECT Id, FORMAT(CreatedDate), TimeType__c FROM TimeTest__c
SELECT Id, FORMAT(CreatedDate), TimeType__c FROM TimeTest__c
SELECT Id, FORMAT(CreatedDate) CreatedDate, TimeType__c FROM TimeTest__c

SELECT 
Id, 
FORMAT(CreatedDate) createddate_formated, 
FORMAT(CreatedDate) createddate_formatedA,
FORMAT(CreatedDate) createddate
FROM TimeTest__c

properties.description: if failed, check storage side -> configuration -> Allow storage account key access

on VM RosinaVM-22env
localhost
instance RosinaMySQL80

in Linux RosinaNATVM (loadbalancer backend VM), need to run console:
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sajitsasi/az-ip-fwd/main/ip_fwd.sh
chmod +x ip_fwd.sh
sudo ./ip_fwd.sh -i eth0 -f 1433 -a rosinavm-test.rosina.com -b 1433
(or sudo ./ip_fwd.sh -i eth0 -f 1433 -a 10.1.1.7 -b 1433)

SFTP server in VM Rosina22env
need to enable "dmgcmd -DisableLocalFolderPathValidation" for connection

scriptLines: body as ({@odata.context} as string, value as ({@microsoft.graph.downloadUrl} as string, cTag as string, createdBy as (user as (displayName as string, email as string, id as string)), createdDateTime as timestamp, eTag as string, file as (hashes as (quickXorHash as string), mimeType as string), fileSystemInfo as (createdDateTime as timestamp, lastModifiedDateTime as timestamp), id as string, lastModifiedBy as (user as (displayName as string, email as string, id as string)), lastModifiedDateTime as timestamp, name as string, parentReference as (driveId as string, driveType as string, id as string, name as string, path as string, siteId as string), shared as (scope as string), size as integer, webUrl as string)[]),
properties as (columns as (name as string, type as string)[], nextLink as string, rows as string[][]),

timestampFormats: ['yyyy-MM-dd','MM/dd/yyyy','dd/MM/yyyy','yyyy/MM/dd','MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm:ss','MM-dd-yyyy','MM/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss a','dd-MM-yyyy','MM-dd-yyyy HH:mm:ss','MM-dd-yyyy hh:mm:ss a','dd.MM.yyyy','MM.dd.yyyy','yyyy.MM.dd','yyyy.MM.dd HH:mm:ss','yyyy.MM.dd hh:mm:ss a','yyyy-MM-dd\'T\'HH:mm:ss','yyyy-MM-dd\'T\'HH:mm:ss\'Z\'','yyyy-MM-dd\'T\'HH:mm:ss.SSS\'Z\'']) ~> source1
